Package fr.cnrs.iees.rvgrid.rendezvous

Class AbstractGridNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.cnrs.iees.rvgrid.rendezvous.AbstractGridNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Observer, GridNode
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CtrlNode, SimNode, StateMachineController, StateMachineEngine
    public abstract class AbstractGridNode
extends java.lang.Object
implements GridNode

    Implementation of GridNode.

    Instances of this class can exchange RVMessage at rendezvous and execute a RendezvousProcess matching the message type.

    Instances of this class register types of messages matching particular actions (= instances of RendezvousProcess) through the addRendezvous method. These types are those that this instance are able to process.

    Whenever a message is received (through a call to the callRendezvous method), it is checked against message types: if the type is already registered, the matching RendezvousProcess is executed; if not, the message is put in a queue for possible later registering of this message type. The next time addRendezvous is called, it will attempt to process all messages contained in the queue.

    Of course one should be careful to always call callRendezvous with a message type that is or will be registered with this instance; otherwise messages can pile up indefinitely.

    This class should be overriden by specialised descendants for any particular implementation of the rendezvous pattern.

    Author:
    Ian Davies - 14 ao√ªt 2019
    after Shayne Flint, 2012

      • addRendezvous

        public AbstractGridNode addRendezvous​(RendezvousProcess process,
                                      int... types)
        Registers a message type in this instance
        Parameters:
        process - the action to undertake on a rendezvous
        types - the type attached to the process
        Returns:
        this instance for agile programming

      • callRendezvous

        public final AbstractGridNode callRendezvous​(RVMessage message)
        This method implements a simple message passing that works for single or multi-thread applications. It has been made final as it is very sensitive code and should not be overriden unless you are a specialist of the rendezvous pattern. In case you want to implement inter-process capabilities, we suggest you define a sister class to this one with the adhoc callRendezVous method.
        Specified by:
        callRendezvous in interface GridNode
        Parameters:
        message - the rendezvous message to pass to the recipient
        Returns:
        this instance for agile programming
